Key Arguments: The Bill is compared to historical censorship, suggesting it will weaken people's ability to recognize and affirm truths by using their reason.
The Bill is seen as an overreach and implies that people lack the rational faculty to dismiss misinformation.
It is argued that the Bill goes against freedom of speech.
The submission suggests the Bill assumes the government is the only source of truth, which is contested.
The Bill is perceived as leading to a dictatorship and suppressing political messaging and contradicting ideologies.
The submission highlights concerns about censorship of professionals on social media.
Notable Quotes: "This Bill takes us back into the past where we lost 51 years of free thought."
"This Bill assumes government is the only source of truth."
"This Bill provides for a dictatorship and will suppress any other political messaging or contradicting ideologies from having a voice."
